alert.note: Alert for Gregg; Harrison; Rusk; Smith; Upshur (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued May 27 at 3:00PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...OZONE ACTION DAY IN EFFECT FOR SATURDAY... The Texas Commission of Environmental Quality (TCEQ) has declared an Ozone Action Day for the Tyler, Longview and Marshall areas of east Texas for Saturday. Atmospheric conditions are expected to be favorable for producing high levels of ozone pollution in the Tyler-Longview area on Saturday. You can help prevent ozone pollution by sharing a ride, walking or riding a bicycle, or even using an electric vehicle. You can mow the lawn or use other small engines in the breeze of the afternoon, instead of during the morning or evening hours when the wind is often calmer; also, avoid long drive-through lanes or a long vehicle idle, and to really conserve energy, keep your vehicles properly tuned. If required on Sunday, the next Ozone Action Day notice will be issued by 300 pm on Saturday. For more information on ozone: Ozone: the Facts (https://www.tceq.texas.gov/airquality/monops/ozonefacts.html) EPA Air Now (https://www.airnow.gov/?reportingArea=Tyler-Longview- Marshall&stateCode=TX) Take Care of Texas (https://takecareoftexas.org/hot-wire/what-ozone-action-day)
